article_title: Holes in oversight leave California workers’ comp vulnerable to fraud
article_text:
Prosecutors contend more than $1 billion has been siphoned from state workers’ comp system

Medicare has more powerful tools to fight fraud

Oversight gaps are compounded because workers have no way to flag bogus care

article_metadata.news-keywords: California, workers compensation, workers comp, fraud, back, knee, injury
article_metadata.description: In many ways, scamming the health system meant to heal California’s injured workers is just too easy. Anyone can hang out a shingle and purport to be a medical vendor or caregiver by sending a letter to the state – no proof required. Unscrupulous providers can run up tens of thousands of dollars in bills for meaningless drug tests, salves and medical equipment, knowing that injured workers never will lay eyes on the bill.
